meanings.definition: The position or office of a rector.
meanings.sent1: The rectorship at the church is responsible for leading the congregation.
meanings.sent2: She was elected to the rectorship of the university for the upcoming academic year.
meanings.sent3: The rectorship at the school was so busy that it started answering emails in its sleep!
meanings.sent4: His rectorship over the company was like a guiding light in times of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The rectorship's influence on campus was undeniable, shaping the future of many students.

meanings.definition: The term of office of a rector.
meanings.sent1: After a successful rectorship, he decided to retire and pass on the responsibilities.
meanings.sent2: The rectorship of the university lasted for five years before a new election was held.
meanings.sent3: The rectorship's calendar was so full that it had to schedule time for relaxation.
meanings.sent4: Her rectorship was a journey filled with challenges and triumphs.
meanings.sent5: The rectorship's legacy continued long after the term had ended.
